Opening Session
sessions.abstract: Consists of welcome remarks and Ex Libris corporate update. This session will include the Presentation of the Azriel Morag Award for Innovation.

sessions.title: How subversive! And how it takes to subvert...
sessions.abstract: Exactly 20 years ago the Subversive Proposal was introduced in a short message on a mailing list. It suggested that researchers should make their work openly and freely available now that we had the World Wide Web, as that would improve the way research was communicated and used. How subversive was that? And why hasn't it come about? Open Access, open science, open innovation - all great concepts into which many have put great hopes. But after a decade of intensive work to achieve these things, and a full two decades since the notion was formally proposed, and indeed after many signs of great promise, we are running into dangerous waters. I will look at progress, promise and potholes for the unwary.

sessions.title: Alma PWG Business Meeting
sessions.abstract: Meeting of the Joint IGeLU/ELUNA Alma PWG. This meeting is open to all. A short business meeting reviewing membership and activities of the PWG for the past year will begin the session. The primary purpose of this session is to hear from users about their Alma experience and determine the focus of PWG activities for the next year. The agenda will be announced via ALMA-L in August.
